title: Benedict Sans ? - A first attempt at Sans Serifs
content:
After reading a few old posts about appropriate sans serifs to accompany classic serifs, I decided to make an attempt at designing a sans serif to accompany the [Benedictine Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414022543/http:/typophile.com/node/100527) face. Tentatively named Benedict Sans, here's what has been done so far for the regular weight (to be followed by book and bold):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414022543im_/http:/typophile.com/files/benedict_sans_6417.png)
  
Thanks in advance for your attention. And have a nice summer ...
author: Alter Littera

comments.content: I like what you have here so far, but I'm not sure those numerals really harmonize with your letterforms. I do enjoy the bit of uncial shown here - it's a nice contrast to the staid stressed-sans. I like that the soft joins remind me of an eye exam :)

Thank you. I will redo the numerals. Meanwhile, here's a first try on the uppercase set (including a few influences from Koch's "Jessen Schrift"):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414022543im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bs_upper_5058.png)
  
Cheers.
Nice idea! I think the {h} is too jarring, though. Maybe give it a descender instead? The {s} is top-heavy.
